column4: has the most recent update to X caused a large number of problems?  my X server is crashing with the error "X: cannot stat /tmp/.X11-unix (Permission denied), aborting.
ls -ld /tmp/.X11-unix in a terminal, what does it say?
i'm running that command as root.
that looks correct, weird that you can't list /tmp/.X11-unix the same way
am i at the point of reinstall?  even root can't access the file. (also bash is coloring it red?)
and it has drwxrwxrwt in fron of it if you run "ls -la /tmp" ?
no that was just the /tmp directory.  .X11-unix has a "?" for each entry on its record in the list.
hm... myabe try removing the whole /tmp-dir and create it again
can i assume the recreate part can be done by rebooting?
I would try "sudo rm -rf /tmp ; sudo mkdir /tmp ; sudo chmod 1777 /tmp"
hm, ok, then I would try to boot the ubuntu liveCD, and do it from there
also, it could sound like there's an error on the filesystem
so reinstall time. fun. thanks. i'll have to deal with this later.
